Input Registers

Adding a New Input Register

There are two ways to add a new Input Register to the configuration:
1. Right-click on the Input Registers group in the System Configuration Tree and select Add Input Register.
2. While the Input Registers group is selected, click the Add One button in the upper-right and corner.

Bulk Adding New Input Registers

There are two ways to add a new Input Register to the configuration:
1. Right-click on the Input Registers group in the System Configuration Tree and select Bulk Add.
2. While the Input Registers group is selected, click the Add One button in the upper-right and corner.
Confirm the options in the dialog box that appears.

Configuring Input Registers

Name: The VeriStand channel name associated with the Input Register.
Address The address of the Input Register, zero-indexed. If your slave device lists the Input Register addresses as between 30001-39999, you will need to subtract 30001 from the value given. Changing the selector next to the Address indicator will toggle input between Decimal and Hexidecimal representations.
DataTypeThe type of data represented in the given register or registers. If the data is more than 16 bits, the channel will read multiple registers and interpret them as the given datatype.
Registers This displays the number of registers a given datatype uses.
Description This is for documentation purposes only, and does not affect the functionality.
